alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Mingo, southwestern Lincoln, Logan, eastern Wayne and west central Boone Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 830 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near East Lynn Lake to Chapmanville. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Beech Fork State Park, Chapmanville, Man, Ranger, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Harts, Chief Logan State, Holden, Gill, East Lynn Lake, Kiahsville, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Chauncey, Bruno, and Wilsondale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
